headline: Sausage Balls
description: Sausage balls are a versatile dish. Serve these savory, Cheddar-filled sausage nibbles for breakfast or brunch or as a game-day or holiday appetizer.

video.description: These juicy sausage balls are great for parties.
video.name: Sausage Balls

name: Sausage Balls
recipeIngredient: 1 pound ground pork sausage, at room temperature

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Combine room temperature sausage and biscuit mix in a large bowl; mix with your hands until well combined. Add shredded Cheddar cheese and mix until fully incorporated. Roll mixture into about 30 walnut-sized balls; transfer to a baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown and sausage is cooked through, 20 to 25 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Using parchment paper helps avoid burning the bottom. Also for me this recipe makes 55 to 60 sausage balls.
How can these be so yummy and so easy???!!! I spiced up the sausage and it was great!

I just made them for the first time and they were great. My husband thought it was silly I wanted to fix them before we went up to see his dad, but had three before we left the house. My father and mother in law loved them too. There's a recipe that calls for cream cheese also, so my husband wants me to fix those next.
These are great. I added a little cayenne pepper and weighed them at 25 grams each for consistency. I usually get 45-50.
I have been making these for years. Those that say they are flavorless are using the wrong sausage. They are the best thing and if you dip them in pepper gravy even better.
I love these sausage balls. I made these for a birthday get together and they are fabulous. Easy peasy!!

Made these for a baby shower and they were a big hit. First, we tripled the recipe - too much to mix together. Used a mixer and mixed a small amount at a time. Next time will mix one batch at a time. They were better the day after, warm or cold!
Super easy recipe with great results. I reduced the cheese slightly (12 oz) and used a Jamaican jerk seasoning for added flavor.
PERFECT AND EASYIEST RECIPE EVER!

I've been making this recipe for years for my family and we all love it. We use Neese's hot sausage (North Carolina). This year, we were in a bind and unable to find Bisquick (I know!). So we substituted pancake mix - the Pearl Milling brand. We couldn't tell the difference. I would bake these on parchment paper so they don't stick to the foil.

This is a simple recipe for me to use. Although sometimes I change it up and use hot sausage and pepper jack cheese (depending on who's eating lol). My 40 yr old son often makes request for the hot sausage balls. Great recipe!!!
Only use 1 cup of bisquick to 1lb of sausage and 1 cup cheddar cheese or else your sausage balls will be dry and taste just like flour
I added a twist and added cream cheese to the mix. They turned out amazing. Very moist and flavorful.

I have made theses every year for 40 years. Instead of breakfast sausage, I use Italian. I normally make five batches at once. I use just a touch less baking mix than the recipe calls for and a touch more cheese. Once the oven reaches temperature, they usually take less time. This year, we used the garlic cheese biscuit mix from Red Lobster, instead of regular baking mix. Even better than they normally are!!
Half the amount of dry mix and reduce the cook time to 14 minutes and you will have moist flavorful balls. Otherwise you will have biscuits flavored with sausage and cheese.

Quick and easy, I added finely chopped onion and some Parmesan cheese, tasty and savory! Just a note: they need a little longer in the oven, I left them in till they were golden brown, about 17 minutes.

These are always great. You may not know it, but you can also make it with pancake mix instead of the biscuit baking mix. I've made them that way after I saw a recipe for it, and they were delicious too. I used a boxed, buttermilk pancake mix for mine.

I love sausage balls, but I agree that the ratio is off. I was always told 2 cups of Bisquick, 1 lb of sausage, and 2 cups (8 oz.) of cheese. I see someone below mentioned that they made it exactly as listed and it was too greasy from the cheese and no one would eat them.
One of my family's favorite holiday treats! I add minced onion and a little garlic powder. Use a lean sausage like Jimmy Dean. Cheap sausage makes greasy balls!
Made as directed, even reducing amount of baking mix. Okay, but very little sausage taste, barely could taste cheese. More like biscuits. Not making again.

Recipe is extremely simple, quick and doesn‚Äôt make a large mess. The only additional ingredients I add are 1/2 cup parmigiana cheese, go garlic powder, paprika and Cajun seasoning..I particularly liked it because of the 2 cups of the biscuit mix. Most of the other online recipes call for 3 cups of biscuit mix which makes the sausage balls a bit dry and flavorless, in my opinion.. I have 3 children with spouses and 11 grandchildren who rave over them. You won‚Äôt ever regret taking an hour of your time to make and bake these appetizers! Sincerely Erin

It's not Christmas around here without at least a single batch of these. I've been making them yearly for over 20 years and here are the changes I make that make people say "yours are always the best, Bev": The hot variety of sausage for the bite. New York Sharp or Extra Sharp cheddar, grate it yourself because they dust the pre-shredded stuff with anti-caking powder. A little less than the full 2 cups of baking mix, they come out more moist and intensely flavored. 1 3/4 is good. Let the sausage sit out for 20 minutes before you work it so that it blends easier, and dump all ingredients into a gallon zip bag, squeeze out excess air, to mix together, it's less messy and one less bowl to wash. You'll know you're done when it releases cleanly from the inside of the bag. Cook on parchment paper or non-stick aluminum foil if you prefer a lined baking sheet, regular foil makes them stick too often. Let them sit and soak up all of that rendered fat as they cool. It's where the flavor is. Most of us cook things to our taste, and there are dozens of variations you can try, this is what works for me. They're probably going to disappear quickly no matter which way you make them.
Great recipe super easy and delicious, I make a batch and I have breakfast for 4 mornings, eat em cold or warmed up they are great.
Simple, easy and delicious! I added minced habanero peppers (2) and minced onion (half a medium one). I dipped in a honey mustard sauce...spicy and great!

Absolutely horrible. I am an experienced baker and cook, for the past 50 years. First of all, the proportions of cheese to meat and Bisquick are way off. 16 oz shredded block cheddar cheese = 4 cups cheese, mixed with a pound of sausage and 2 cups Bisquick. I mixed it well. The cheese took over and melted everywhere. This is so greasy, it's inedible. I used one Jimmy Dean sage sausage roll. All I can taste is cheese. I would have used half the amount of cheese, 2 cups (8 oz shredded) would have been much better. I'm annoyed that I spent $12 on ingredients and no one will touch it. Like lead balls of pure grease. Epic Fail.
Oh my goodness these are definitely not Italian food. Don't serve them with marinara! Serve them with maple syrup. Or just eat them plain - traditionally these are NOT eaten with any kind of sauce.
Made them exactly as the recipe says. They are very heavy and dense. I served them with Marinara . Just too dense.

Sausage balls are great for any occasion! I've been making them for over 35 years! They go quickly, so make a double batch. I love eating them gor breakfast, because it's like eating a sausage biscuit all-in-one!! ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
It‚Äôs a very good recipe. Good for Christmas Breakfast. Good for make ahead and reheat.
Very easy and makes a lot.
No I did not make changes and they were a hit.
Takes me back to when my mamaw used to make them! They were delicious!! My kids love them to and one of them don't don't like cheese lol.
The hardest part about this recipe, is deciding what to dip them in before eating. This is my goto during the holidays
Always a hit! I put all three ingredients in my stand up KItchenAid Mixer and let it do all the work!
Super easy and delicious recipe! We use this recipe every Christmas, as well! Makes a wonderful tradition.

Thank goodness somebody finally did what we have been doing in our family for years! CUT THAT BISQUICK! The original recipe that my Mom got back in the mid 1980's had 3 cups per every pound.....that tasted like a biscuit with sausage and cheese flavoring. Some people even tried adding milk.....EEEEWWWW...... Per pound of sausage, we only use 1 cup of bisquick, Hot sausage, a spash of worcestershire sauce, and one large pkg shredded sharp cheddar. About 30-35 min at 350 degrees, and they disappear in record time!!
Used coby jack cheese instead of sharp cheddar
Bland, bland, bland. A maple glaze helped, but I wouldn't make again.
I make this a lot. It is fast and easy only 3 ingredients and people love them. Great snack!

Love Sausage Balls !!! Easy way to get breakfast on the go. Make a batch, put leftovers in fridge, grab a couple on the way out each morning. My wife and I use Carbquik baking flour to make them keto-friendly.

These are way too dry. I referred to the Bisquick website and looked at the original recipe. It says to use 2 Cups of cheese which is 1/2 the amount this recipe calls for. I feel like that would make the recipe right. The video for this recipe shows two handfuls (which would be about two cups not a full pound). Maybe it was supposed to say one package (8 Oz).
I believe when the review stating precooked means you can make several and freeze and pull out and heat for 10 minutes. Also I cut back a little on the bisquick that I sifted and was not too dry.
Wonderful!!! I have used many many times!!! Kids and daily absolutely love them and beg for more!! ‚ù§Ô∏èüíï
I made the recipe exactly by the recipe. It was perfect and delicious!!
My husband loves these it does not have to be a special occasion. He lives these anytime. Thanks for the recipe.
Using two cups of biscuit mix is TOO MUCH! You can't even taste the sausage. One cup is all you should use!

My family has made these for years. 
I must have missed something , people acting like the poster of the recipe said cook the sausage. I never saw that in the directions. Why would you pre cook the sausage ?? I've NEVER heard of that .
Just asking ....

The recipe is good. However, I purchased shredded cheese that turned out to be too chunky. I‚Äôve made sausage balls before that were better with smaller shreds. These tasted okay, just too much cheese.
My family and I really like this simple recipe. I substitute pork sausage for venison and it‚Äôs delicious.
The sausage is a small part of the ingredients when blended. I would actually rename this recipe to Cheesy Sausage Biscuits.
Super easy to make and sooo delicious. Planning to serve these for new years party

I would like to point out that you NEVER cook the sausage before mixing the ingredients...ever. With that said, I like a little onion flavor. Finely chopped chives fresh or dried work well. Fresh can go right into the mix. If using dried, I pour 2-3 tablespoons of milk in a bowl with equal amount of dried chive, then let them reconstitute for about 10 minutes. There isn't an exact measurement to this. It is up to you on how much onion flavor you want. 2-3 tablespoons works quite well. 1:1 ratio.
Simple and delicious!
Fantastic recipe, my mother made them for hors d‚Äô ourves. After they cooled to room temp she would stick a toothpick into each one. They went fast.
Turned out perfectly. I did turn them halfway through to ensure equal cooking and consistent coloring.
I love this recipe. I use less cheese, but that is a personal preference, but these are great during the holidays for something to eat while the big meal is being made.
Delicious!!! My family just absolutely fell in love with them.
I think you should do 1 1/2 cups of biscuit baking mix instead of 2 cups. Extra cheese is great!!
This is a very easy recipe and my family loves them.

My Mom made this recipe 20+ years ago but the only difference is she had some duck sauce to dip them in with toothpicks.
You can use as an appetizer also

This recipe is the same as mine except I add a little bit of Worchestershire sauce. Game changer! I've also added chives, fennel seed, savory, sage, Chipoltle Tabasco, and onion and garlic powder. (Individually....not all at the same time). I've tried different cheeses too like smoked gouda or English cheddar but sharp cheddar is my favorite. I may try adding some blue cheese with the sharp cheddar to my next batch. There are so many variations to try I make these year round.

Sooo dry! 
Maybe the sausage I used was very lean? Regardless, if I make these again, I'll switch the amounts of Bisquick and cheese. (one cup of Bisquick and two cups of cheese)
I've made these quite a few times. The last several I added one egg and 1/4 cup of milk into the mix. Seems to make mixing easier and adds a bit of additional flavor in the finished product.

A great recipe but next time I‚Äôll make some changes. One cup Bisquick with One pound of sausage is enough because two cups of Bisquick made it difficult to mix and made the mixture too powdery and doughy. I‚Äôd also add an egg to bind the ingredients better and plus the egg adds some moisture. Adding the cheese after everything is mixed is a great idea because it mixes better.
Delicious! Also try with spicy sausage.

This my second attempt at making sausage balls. I always make a recipe the way its written the first time. 
This was easy and pretty good.
Maybe using homemade sausage had something to do w with it. lol
I would recommend this recipe.
Love this recipe! I‚Äôve modified it slightly to make it a bit less biscuit-y. I use 1 cup of bisquick and I also use maple breakfast sausage :) super popular in my house!

I've made/eaten these my entire life. Last week my friend made some for girls'night and they were awesome! She tried adding cream cheese and wow, they were amazing and maintained their moisture which made reheating even better.
First batch didn‚Äôt stick together so I tried the recommendation of adding cheese last. I just bought a new roasting pan so anxious to bake on that so they drain better.

Really good! Followed the directions but then skimmed the reviews... per someone‚Äôs recommendation, I mixed the sausage with the baking mix first, then added the cheese. Also added 1/2 C milk. Baked for 30 min. Yummy!
I have made these since the 70's. I was glad to find the recipe. My family love it!

1) Do not use lean sausage.

2) Cut Bisquik to 1 1/2 cups.

3) Needs something to bind the balls together.

These were so great they are dangerous. I mixed it up the night and put in the fridge then baked them cold. I added grated onion, otherwise followed directions exactly. They were so good that no one in our house could stop eating them. Making more tomorrow! Yum! 
(Served for brunch with homemade honey mustard.)

I made this recipe for the first time following the instructions. The only user suggestions I used were to let the meat sit at room temp for 20 minutes before mixing, finely shred the cheese, and work the meat for a loooong time. These were so dry that my family refused to eat them. I however, truly loved the flavor and decided to give it a second go. If you found these to dry too it's very simple... reduce the biscuit mix! 1 1/4 cups seems to be the best ratio for us. This has become a regular go to for quick easy meals.

Very good! Perfect as is but I added black pepper and about 1 tablespoon of water. The water was to get rid of the powdery mix, which I blended with the sausage prior to adding the cheese. My tip is to use a small cookie scoop - faster than rolling each one. I made this the night before. Highly recommend this recipe!
Delicious! We‚Äôve made these for years and always love them. The last few years we started adding 8 oz of cream cheese. They are so much more moist.

This recipe is certainly a good one. But be aware that if followed precisely then it‚Äôll make very ‚Äúbiscuit-y‚Äù balls. If you like yours a tad more meaty/cheesy just cut the bisquick in half. I used 1 cup instead of 2 and it was perfect consistency for my personal tastes. Also, one other reviewer advised mixing the sausage and bisquick FIRST before adding the cheese. This is INVALUABLE advice. Way better to do it this way. Lastly, extra sharp cheddar is the way to go. Not overpowering at all but does a great job standing up to the sausage flavor for a well rounded taste.

Used to make these years ago but lost the recipe. These taste excellent but thank goodness I bought three 1-lb packages of ground sausage, as two pounds of cheese was too much. Three pounds of sausage to two pounds of cheese and 1/4c extra Bisquick worked great.

I made them by the recipe as written and they were very good. I then made some using Mild Italian Sausage and some using Hot Italian Sausage. Added 2 tablespoons of finely minced garlic and about a 1/4 cup Grated Parmesan Romano Cheese to the sausage before adding the bisquick and cheddar cheese. They were very tasty, but next time I will add 1/3 lb more sausage as I like a more pronounced sausage taste. It's a great basic recipe to make several different flavors for appetizers. Best of all you can make them ahead. Each batch yielded about 54 balls.
I made these.last night, I added a can of rotel to my mixture, they turned out great. I cooked them for a bit longer because of the rotel, and it is worth the time.
A good recipe. The only change I made was I added a little Cajun Spice Mix.

I think this recipe is perfect! I made these for my boyfriend and I the other night, and he devoured them within a couple of hours!

Super simple, yet SUPER DELICIOUS!

Thank you for this easy peasy recipe.

Best,

Hannah Banana
helpful tip. let cheese and sausage warm up for awhile before mixing dont use straight from the fridge its harder to mix

I‚Äôm a huge fan of sausage balls. I‚Äôve also found that if I lower the amount of biscuit mix and only do about a cup or 3/4 of a cup, they‚Äôre more ‚Äúsausagey‚Äù but hold together great. I never have any left at a gathering vs. when someone makes them more bread like.
if you add an egg white, they'll be a little bit moister and crisp up nicely!
These are so delicious with maple syrup on top. I actually cooked them in the pressure cooker, sauteed them first then cooked them pot in pot. They came out perfect.

I wasn't a fan of this recipe they come out very dry. My old recipe that I cannot find calls for cheese whiz and milk. I did not have cheese whiz so I added milk to make them moister. On my on my second batch hopefully they come out better than the first!

I was very close to adding some kind of liquid to the bowl because it was super dry. I definitely recommend either leaving the cheese out to get to room temperature or this was my "hack." I used a metal mixing bowl but put it on top of the heated oven for about 5 minutes to kind of soften the cheese. The balls came out perfect after that! 3 stars but might be due to not using super flavorful sausage and used a mix of cheddar (super sharp-had to shred plus preshredded cheddar blend). I think maybe adding chives like another reviewer suggested might add some flavor.
These were great. Someone suggested using the dough hook on kitchen Aid to mix all together and that turned out perfect!
These are a MUST for any gathering at my house. I have had family demand them!
Super easy to make, and really yummy. They were a hit with my kids.

Easy and quick to make. I will advise to mix the ingredients as you put them in. I dumped all 3 ingredients into a bowl and found that the sausage didn't really want to mingle with the pancake mix and the shredded cheese just got in the way of that process. So maybe wait to throw in the cheese until your sausage and pancake mix is well mixed together.
I made this EXACTLY as the recipe instructed. Dry and completely inedible. Two cups of Bisquick is WAYYY too much. I'm so angry at this recipe for wasting my money.
It is amazing ??????

It's missing something. I used Hot sausage, (raw), and 1/2 cup (additional) of extra sharp cheese..but, its still missing taste. Someone mentioned using stuffing mix, and I read elsewhere adding sage. I also think the biscuit mix should be reduced by 1/2 cup--mine were on dry side. I also think cooking 20 minutes is too long, maybe only 15 min is better. They just were quite tasteless as written. Disappointing. But, I may try again doing different things..
It is amazing !!!
It‚Äôs so goooooood nom nom nom

WOW, easy to do, hardly any ingredients & they taste fantastic, what more could you ask for. We used Jimmy Dean hot sausage & regular cheddar cheese, don't usually buy sharp, so used what we had. Hubs had to add more bisquick because they were very sticky and wouldn't roll nicely even though the reviews said to use less bisquick. A big will make again.
This is the best version of this recipe I've found! If the sausage is not straight out of the fridge, it's definitely easier to mix. Also, mix sausage and baking mix first, then add the cheese.
